The campaign mode for Counter-Strike. Not much more to say really.  The "Deleted Scenes" are just a story mode, and Tour of Duty is a good way to get to know the maps. Multiplayer is surprisingly active, if that's your thing.  Overall, pretty fun little game that's a bit off the beaten path.

I actually do like the campaign aspect of this game.
The game before CSGO...that bring my friends to gather.

Counter-Strike:Condition Zero is an interesting one. At a glance, Condition Zero (CZ) looks similar to CS 1.6 but with better looking weapon and player models. However, the game actually has a few differences in terms of content.

There's the classic multiplayer mode that has official bot support for the maps that come with the game. This part of the game should be familiar to those who play CS 1.6. You can install new maps and the game will attempt to generate the navigation mesh for the bots. If the bots aren't playing well on custom maps, you can finetune it manually too.

There's also a Tour of Duty campaign mode where you are given "scenarios" that are using the multiplayer maps with specific victory conditions. Clearing scenarios gives you points, which you can use to recruit teammates who join your team as friendly bots. This mode is actually moddable as well, so you can create your own campaigns.

The bots can differ in their difficulty as well, which is kind of nice. Being older now (Man, has it been that long since CZ came out?), I always appreciate it when games have bot support. Sure, it can't replicate the experience of pitting your skills against real players but bots are great for warming up or for days where you just want to chill or mess around to relax.

Outside of multiplayer, there is a decent singleplayer campaign, called Deleted Scenes, that revolves around individual counter-terrorist scenarios, allowing you to play as the different CT units that are portrayed in multiplayer such as the SEALs, GSG9 and SAS. It's actually pretty fun, all things considered and it answers the question: "What if Counter-Strike had a singleplayer campaign?".

Despite being on the GoldSrc engine, there's just something about the pre-Source Counter-Strikes that I really like. Maybe its the nostalgia glasses here but I prefer the responsiveness of the GoldSrc engine to the floatiness that Source seems to have at times. And maybe its because I grew up during the GoldSrc era and I've gotten so used to the look of the game and the other GoldSrc games.

If there's another reason why I've stuck with CZ and CS 1.6, it might be because that unlike Global Offensive, one does not need to pay money for skins just to customise their game. One can go to dedicated modding sites to find weapon skins, player models and maps to enhance their Counter-Strike experience. However, do take note that because CS 1.6 is its predecessor, CZ has lesser mods available for it.

Overall, if you already have CS 1.6, CZ's multiplayer mode doesn't really add much but if you are interested in the singleplayer campaign, you could get CZ just for that.

To be honest, I didn't really like this game and I wouldn't recommend you to buy it, but it comes with the CS:CZ Deleted Scenes which is more fun to play and enjoyable. 

Rating:
Counter-Strike: Condition Zero: 5.5/10
Counter-Strike: Condition Zero Deleted Scenes: 8/10

This is the one! The one I couldn't stop playing until I finished it up back in early 2000s when it was released. Epic CS only finally with a solid, intriguing, bare-metal Counter-Strike on story-based single player with missions that take you around the globe featuring special forces like GSG-9, Specnaz, SEAL Team 6, etc.!

Storyline of the deleted scenes are really realistic compared to other Counter-Strike series & the release of Condition Zero without the deleted scene has no story modes & its no where to be found at all.

I've never been a major fan of CS, but I really do like single player games, this is probably my favorite CS game because I simply don't have any experience with the others.
It's very difficult, but it's the kind of difficult that makes you feel so good.

A fun singleplayer addition to the Counter-Strike franchise that may help you get better at the goldsource games without having to embarrass yourself on multiplayer servers. The team picking mechanic is also very engaging. I saw no reason why this was the black sheep of the CS franchise. I'm having plenty of fun!
